definition: thousand articles, same rule (idiom); stereotyped and repetitive/once you've seen one, you've seen them all
sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Also remember that one size does not fit all when optimizing pages.
sentences.chinese: 还要记住，在对页面进行优化时不要千篇一律。

sentences.english: Presidents have invariably also been Protestants and two-thirds of them have been college graduates.
sentences.chinese: 总统千篇一律是新教徒，而且三分之二是大学毕业生。

sentences.english: All the routine work really bores me to death.
sentences.chinese: 每天千篇一律的工作真的烦死我了。

sentences.english: A:All the routine work really browns me off.
sentences.chinese: 每天千篇一律的工作真让我讨厌。

sentences.english: To avoid monotony, we must always find something fresh, new.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免千篇一律，我们必须发掘新意。

sentences.english: They simply hate living a monotonous life and doing the same everyday things.
sentences.chinese: 他们讨厌千篇一律的生活或做重复单调的事。

sentences.english: Springs are not always the same.
Are you writing down the same things for meals almost every day?
sentences.chinese: 你是否会记录下每天几乎千篇一律的饭菜？

sentences.english: The machine-made thing on the net it is to also won't not like to look.
sentences.chinese: 网上的千篇一律的东西它是不会去也不喜欢去看的。

sentences.english: Repetitive design with neither features nor originality.
sentences.chinese: 酒店设计千篇一律，缺乏特色和创意。

sentences.english: It was of a pattern which does not vary, and it is familiar to us all.
sentences.chinese: 那是些千篇一律的话，都是我们大家听惯了的。

sentences.english: But to me they seem to be all the same.
sentences.chinese: 可是，在我看来，它们似乎都是千篇一律。

sentences.english: Anyway, the profiles you read, they’re like bathtubs. There’s no variation.
sentences.chinese: 总之，你看的那些简介，就像浴缸一样千篇一律。

sentences.english: Why do different customers, sales staff rhetoric fits?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不同的客户，销售人员说词千篇一律？

sentences.english: Most striking is the architectural uniformity.
sentences.chinese: 最引人注目的还是房屋的千篇一律。

sentences.english: Thousand side, fits, can not be a first-class university.
sentences.chinese: 千人一面，千篇一律，不可能出一流大学”。

definition: nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
good-looking/nice-looking/good (of a movie, book, TV show etc)/embarrassed/humiliated
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
